SHA256 counter tests

The tests verify that the SHA256 counter doesn\textquotesingle{}t wrap around at message length 2\texorpdfstring{$^\wedge$}{\string^}i bytes for i = 20, ..., 33. This wide range aims at being independent of the implementation of the counter and it catches multiple natural 32-\/bit overflows (e.\+g., counting bits, counting bytes, counting blocks, ...).

The test vectors have been generated using following Python script which relies on \href{https://github.com/cloudtools/sha256/}{\texttt{ https\+://github.\+com/cloudtools/sha256/}} (v0.\+3 on Python v3.\+10.\+2).
